channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘It was obvious I wasn’t in Kansas anymore’: My local bank has no cashiers — and it went downhill from there. What’s happened to all the banks?
item.description: “There were tellers, three chairs, visible safe-deposit boxes and an ATM.”

item.title: AMD reports record revenue but Q4 forecast disappoints
item.description: Advanced Micro Devices reported record Q3 revenue of $6.8 billio, up 18%. But the shares fell due to a disappointing forecast for Q4.

item.title: AWS launches in-line Q Developer AI coding assistant to take on Microsoft’s Github Copilot
item.description: Amazon Q Developer’s inline chat feature demonstrates its potential through practical applications like code refactoring and documentation.

item.title: Study finds LLMs can identify their own mistakes
item.description: It turns out that LLMs encode quite a bit of knowledge about the truthfulness of their answers, even when they give the wrong one.

item.title: Eli Lilly’s stock dives as Mounjaro and Zepbound sales miss, but Citi says buy
item.description: Eli Lilly’s stock heads for biggest selloff in 24 years after sales of anti-obesity drugs Mounjaro and Zepbound came up well short of forecasts.

item.title: Pending home sales jump to six-month high as lower mortgage rates draw buyers in
item.description: U.S. pending home sales rose 7.4% in September, the National Association of Realtors said on Wednesday.

item.title: LinkedIn upgrades its Recruiter with an AI Hiring Assistant
item.description: LinkedIn's new Hiring Assistant will let recruiters use AI agents to find the most qualified candidates based on their LinkedIn profile.

item.title: Our son lived in our basement ‘finding himself.’ We give him an allowance — and now he lives off gig work in a studio with his girlfriend. What can we do?
item.description: “He isn’t interested in further formal education.”
